definitions: going back or changing to an earlier condition, practice, or state of being
examples: The software keeps reverting to its default settings
He's reverting to his old bad habits again

definitions: having been examined and corrected or updated to include new information or improvements
examples: The revised edition includes three new chapters
She submitted her revised proposal to the committee

definitions: restored to life, energy, or strength after a period of decline or inactivity
examples: The revitalised downtown area attracts many visitors
She felt revitalised after her vacation

definitions: restored to life, energy, or strength after a period of decline or inactivity
examples: The revitalized neighborhood features new shops and restaurants
The team felt revitalized with their new coach

definitions: giving new life, energy, or strength to something that has become weak or inactive
examples: The revitalizing effects of exercise are well documented
This revitalizing face mask makes skin look younger

definitions: restored to life or consciousness after apparent death or unconsciousness
brought back into use, activity, or prominence after decline
examples: The revived patient slowly opened his eyes
Paramedics revived her after the accident
The revived tradition attracts tourists every year
Interest in vinyl records has been revived recently

definitions: bringing back to life, consciousness, or strength; causing renewal or restoration
examples: The reviving smell of coffee filled the kitchen
A reviving shower helped her wake up completely

definitions: causing intense disgust or strong feelings of dislike and repulsion
rising in rebellion against established authority or government
examples: The revolting smell made everyone leave the room
That revolting behavior is completely unacceptable
The revolting masses stormed the palace gates
Revolting peasants demanded better working conditions

definitions: moved in a circular orbit around a central point or axis
examples: The revolved door let customers enter the building
Her revolved world centered entirely on her children

definitions: providing satisfaction, pleasure, or profit as a return for effort or achievement
examples: Teaching can be a very rewarding career choice
The rewarding experience made all the hard work worthwhile

definitions: relating to the art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing
asked merely for effect with no answer expected or implied
examples: His rhetorical skills impressed the debate judges
The politician's rhetorical flourishes energized the crowd
That's a rhetorical question that needs no response
Her rhetorical query made everyone think deeply

definitions: relating to or caused by rheumatism, affecting joints and connective tissues with pain
examples: Her rheumatic joints ached during cold weather
The doctor prescribed medication for his rheumatic condition

definitions: relating to a chronic progressive disease causing inflammation in joints and resulting in painful deformity
examples: Rheumatoid arthritis requires ongoing medical treatment
Her rheumatoid symptoms worsened during winter months

definitions: having words with endings that sound alike, especially at line ends in poetry
examples: The rhymed couplets made the poem easy to memorize
Children enjoy rhymed stories more than prose

definitions: having or creating words with similar ending sounds, especially in poetry or songs
examples: The rhyming dictionary helped her write song lyrics
Rhyming games teach children about language patterns

definitions: having or relating to a strong, regular repeated pattern of movement or sound
examples: The rhythmic pounding of drums filled the stadium
Her rhythmic breathing indicated deep sleep

definitions: occurring with measured regularity or having a pattern of regular beats or movements
examples: The rhythmical swaying of trees calmed her nerves
Rhythmical exercises help improve coordination

definitions: marked with or having raised lines or ridges running in parallel patterns
examples: The ribbed sweater provided extra warmth
Ribbed rubber mats prevent slipping in wet conditions

definitions: pierced with many holes, especially from bullets or disease
pervaded or spread throughout with something undesirable or problematic
examples: The old fence was riddled with termite damage
Bullets had riddled the abandoned car
The report was riddled with factual errors
Their relationship was riddled with mistrust

definitions: marked by or having long narrow raised bands or elevated lines on surface
examples: The ridged potato chips have better flavor retention
His ridged fingernails indicated a health problem

definitions: relating to the Iberian Peninsula or its peoples, including Spain and Portugal
examples: Iberian cuisine features lots of seafood and olive oil
The Iberian lynx is an endangered wild cat

definitions: relating to Iceland, its people, language, or culture in the North Atlantic
examples: Icelandic horses are small but incredibly strong
She's learning Icelandic before her trip to Reykjavik

definitions: relating to the Inca people or their empire in ancient South America
examples: Incan ruins attract thousands of tourists to Peru
The Incan calendar was remarkably accurate

definitions: relating to Indonesia, its people, languages, or culture in Southeast Asia
examples: Indonesian food often features rice and spicy sauces
She speaks fluent Indonesian after living in Jakarta

definitions: relating to ancient Ionia or its people in western Asia Minor and Greek islands
examples: Ionian architecture features distinctive column designs
The Ionian revolt sparked wider conflicts in Greece

definitions: relating to or containing ions as electrically charged atoms or molecules
relating to the Ionic order of classical Greek architecture with scroll capitals
examples: Ionic bonds form between metals and non-metals
The ionic solution conducted electricity efficiently
The ionic columns adorned the museum entrance
Ionic architecture influenced many government buildings

definitions: relating to the Ismaili branch of Shia Islam or its followers worldwide
examples: The Ismaili community center offers educational programs
Ismaili traditions emphasize intellectual and spiritual balance

definitions: printed or written in slanted letters that lean to the right for emphasis
relating to ancient Italy or its peoples before the Roman Empire
examples: The italic font emphasizes important terms
Book titles are usually printed in italic type
Italic tribes inhabited the peninsula before Rome
The italic languages influenced modern Italian

definitions: especially of something undesirable, widespread and existing in large numbers or amounts
examples: The city was rife with corruption and crime
Rumors were rife about the company's future

definitions: having spiral grooves cut inside a gun barrel to make bullets spin
examples: The rifled barrel improved the weapon's accuracy
Modern firearms use rifled barrels for better range

definitions: equipped with ropes, sails, and masts on a ship or boat
arranged dishonestly to produce a predetermined or unfair outcome
examples: The fully rigged sailing ship left the harbor
The rigged mast could withstand strong winds
The rigged election results sparked massive protests
Everyone knew the contest was rigged from the start

definitions: morally right, justified, or virtuous; acting in accord with divine or moral law
examples: His righteous anger at injustice motivated him to act
She lived a righteous life helping those in need

definitions: having a legitimate or legally established claim; proper according to law or morality
examples: The rightful heir returned to claim the throne
She demanded her rightful share of the inheritance

definitions: supporting or relating to political views that favor traditional values and free enterprise
examples: The rightist party won a majority in parliament
His rightist views opposed government regulation

definitions: situated at or being the position farthest to the right side
examples: Click the rightmost button to save your work
The rightmost lane is for passing only

definitions: unable to bend or be forced out of shape; not flexible
unable or unwilling to change or compromise; strictly maintained
examples: The rigid metal frame supported the entire structure
Rigid plastic doesn't bend under normal pressure
Their rigid schedule allowed no time for spontaneity
The school's rigid rules frustrated many students

definitions: extremely thorough, exhaustive, and accurate, demanding strict attention to rules and procedures
examples: The rigorous testing ensured product safety
Medical school requires rigorous academic preparation

definitions: having a border, edge, or rim around the outer part of something
examples: Her rimmed glasses made her look scholarly
The gold-rimmed plates were saved for special occasions

definitions: surrounded by or marked with a ring or rings; having circular bands
examples: Saturn is ringed by spectacular bands of ice
The ringed plover has distinctive markings

definitions: marked by or involving public disorder, wild and uncontrolled behavior
hilariously funny; causing or characterized by unrestrained laughter
examples: The riotous crowd destroyed several storefronts
Riotous behavior led to multiple arrests
The comedian's riotous performance had everyone laughing
It was a riotous evening of entertainment

definitions: fully developed and ready to be eaten or harvested
having arrived at the fitting stage or time for something
examples: The ripe tomatoes were perfect for sauce
These ripe peaches smell wonderfully sweet
The situation is ripe for major changes
The market seemed ripe for new investment

definitions: brought to full development or maturity, especially for harvesting or use
examples: The ripened fruit fell from the tree naturally
Properly ripened cheese has complex flavors

definitions: torn or pulled apart forcefully, having tears or holes
having very well-defined muscles from intensive physical training
examples: His ripped jeans were fashionably distressed
The ripped sail needed immediate repair
The athlete's ripped physique impressed everyone
He got ripped after months at the gym

definitions: tearing or pulling something apart with force or violence
examples: The ripping sound meant her dress had caught
Strong winds were ripping branches from trees

definitions: having moved from a lower position to a higher one; increased
examples: The risen sun painted the sky orange
Bread prices have risen significantly this year

definitions: moving from a lower position to a higher one
increasing in amount, number, or intensity
examples: The rising smoke signaled their location
Rising mist covered the valley floor
Rising costs forced them to cut expenses
The rising generation faces new challenges

definitions: slightly indecent or inappropriate; bordering on impropriety but still acceptable
examples: Her risque jokes made some guests uncomfortable
The movie's risque scenes earned it an adult rating

definitions: relating to or done as a religious or solemn rite; following established ceremonies
examples: Their ritualistic morning routine never varied
The tribe's ritualistic dances honored their ancestors

definitions: completely engrossing or compelling; holding one's attention completely
examples: The riveting documentary kept viewers glued to their seats
She told a riveting story about her adventures

definitions: lacking roads or highways; describing wilderness areas without vehicle access
examples: The roadless wilderness area remained pristine
Roadless regions require hiking or flying to access
